newsitem.title: USA: PUMA AG names U.S. CEO, COO.
newsitem.headline: PUMA AG names U.S. CEO, COO.

text.p: PUMA AG has named former Nike and Adidas AG executive James Gorman president of PUMA North America.
Mats Gustafsson was named chief operating officer of PUMA North America. He previously served as president, North America for Abu Garcia, Inc, a maker and marketer of sports equipment worldwide.
The subsidiary of the German sportwear maker contributed only $30 million to the worldwide sales of 1.2 billion marks, PUMA AG CEO Jochen Zeitz said in a telephone interview.

"Clearly our plans are to improve our market share because the U.S. represents 50 percent of the sporting goods market," Zeitz said. He noted the parent company only reacquired the name PUMA in the U.S. two years ago and has been managing it as a subsidiary instead of as a licensee for just 12 months.
"So there is a big shift that has gone on, switching from a European-based product management sort of to a U.S.-driven business management," Zeitz said.

Gorman, who formerly worked for both Nike and Adidas in senior management roles, replaces Herbert Elliott, an Australian. Elliott, an Olympic Gold medal winner, has been invited to serve on PUMA's boards in North America and Australia. He is expected to return to Australia.
